dialogueLines: You know what’s funny? You always go quiet when things get serious.
Like, I start talking about something real, and suddenly you turn into a statue.
I’m not asking you to solve the world’s problems — just maybe nod? Or blink twice if you agree?
Last time we fought, you disappeared for two days. I thought you joined a monastery or something.
And then you came back with that same face — like you just forgot what happened!
I swear, arguing with you is like arguing with a mirror that occasionally sighs.
Anyway… I’m not mad. Just… disappointedly dramatic.
Which, let’s be honest, is my best look.

questions.questionText: What did I say you turn into when things get serious?
questions.correctResponse: Exactly! A statue — because you go completely silent.
questions.wrongResponse: No… I said you turn into a statue, remember?

questions.questionText: What did I say you did last time we fought?
questions.correctResponse: Right! You vanished for two days — like a magician with bad timing.
questions.wrongResponse: No… I said you disappeared for two days!

questions.questionText: Where did I joke you might’ve gone?
questions.correctResponse: Correct! I said you probably joined a monastery.
questions.wrongResponse: Nope! I joked about you joining a monastery.

questions.questionText: What did I compare arguing with you to?
questions.correctResponse: Exactly! Like arguing with a mirror that occasionally sighs.
questions.wrongResponse: No… I said it’s like arguing with a mirror!

questions.questionText: How did I describe my mood at the end?
questions.correctResponse: Right! I said I’m disappointedly dramatic — my best look, remember?
questions.wrongResponse: No… I said disappointedly dramatic, not mad!
